main event: A civilian observed a small white object blinking with a dim blue glow in Addison, New York, for 25 minutes on April 23, 1953.
interesting points: The object first appeared stationary before moving slowly away at an estimated distance of 2 miles., The observer was a 29-year-old male forest ranger., The object was described as having a black stripe running from top to bottom., The observer suspected the object might have been a meteorite., The sighting was reported to officials on April 14, 1953, nine days before the event.
sighted object: small white blinking object with a dim blue glow
